title: The influence of concentrated ownership, board independence, and corporate social responsibility disclosure towards market liquidity and firm value of consumer goods companies in Indonesia
abstract: This research aims to provide a better understanding of the influence of concentrated ownership, board independence, and corporate social responsibility disclosure towards market liquidity and firm value in the consumer goods industry sector in Indonesia. This research observes the listed public companies in the Indonesia Stock Exchange included in the consumer goods industry sector and has published their annual report for five years from 2014- 2018. The data for this research will be gathered from Bloomberg and companies Annual Report. Furthermore, the collected data will be processed using the Ordinary Least Square method to examine the influence of concentrated ownership, board independence, and corporate social responsibility disclosure towards market liquidity and firm value.
contributors: Saarce Elsye Hatane (Advisor 1); Josua Tarigan (Examination Committee 1); Foedjiawati, S.S., M.A., Ph.D. (Examination Committee 2)
